file_content.text: I wondered what that incredible smell was. Mind telling me why you brought it on board?
You wouldn't believe the week I've had.
It's a long story.
Try me. I promise to keep an open mind.
How about you help me find the sonic shower?
[Flirt] Let's wash it off.
I'm afraid you're on your own with that.
That smell could be coming from anywhere.
How do you know it was me?
Point taken. Plenty of other things might be responsible.
Why is everybody looking at me?
I expected to be the only woman on this ship. Are you one of Skavak's special friends?
I was just about to ask you the same question.
No. Are you?
Skavak and I are anything but friends. Frankly, I don't know what girls see in him.
I wouldn't touch that man with a two-meter bantha prod.
Don't be insane.
I like you already. Any woman who knows better than to play with Skavak is alright by me.
I'm taking a wild guess that my life just got a new kind of complicated.
This freighter and everything in it belongs to me, lady.
You're on my ship.
That so? What an exciting development.
Funny, I don't remember leaving a beautiful woman in my cargo hold. Must be my lucky day.
[Flirt] Hello, gorgeous.
Depends on your definition of "lucky."
If you're with Skavak, your life is about to end.
Depends who you work for.
With Skavak? Hardly. Put down the blaster and let's talk.
My name's Risha. I've been traveling with Skavak as part of a business arrangement.
What kinda business are you in, that you keep a guy's head in a jar?
Don't judge me by my cargo. A girl can't always choose how she earns a living, or who she deals with.
He and I had a deal to deliver the things you see here.
None of this stuff looks like cargo to me.
You call this cargo?
Very unique items intended for very unique buyers.
Interesting.
Skavak isn't known for honoring his deals.
You picked a bad partner.
Then maybe my luck is about to change.
Skavak was going to deliver this cargo, but he's proving unreliable. I think you might be a much better partner.
Let's hear your offer, and we'll see.
I'm open to negotiations.
My offer is simple: I make you filthy rich. It's a pretty straightforward business model.
Lady, I barely know you. Why would I agree to any deal?
I don't trust you.
Because I'm willing to earn your trust. The real question is, will you give me the chance to make you rich?
Pack up and go.
You haven't even heard my offer yet. The fact is, I can make you very wealthy.
What do you know... that's Skavak on the ship's holo. This should be an interesting conversation.
You're late, Skavak--and I just made a new friend. I think you two will loathe each other.
Congratulations, Captain. You're officially number one on my list of people to kill.
Hope there's room for me on that list. I hate feeling left out.
Don't sweat it, Corso. I promise to kill you second.
When I get my hands on you, you'll wish you'd never left Ord Mantell.
Can't kill what you can't catch, Skavak. And you don't have a ship.
Eat my exhaust, pal.
Plenty of ships to steal on Coruscant. I'm sure I'll find something fast and deadly.
Best of luck.
You don't even know what you've stumbled into, Captain. You're messing up a deal I spent months putting together.
Come and get me any time you want.
Ready when you are, Skavak.
You can bet on it, and I guarantee you won't see me coming.
Don't know how you got away from those Imperials, but next time I'll kill you myself. Assuming Rogun the Butcher doesn't get you first.
I sold all those blasters you were supposed to deliver for him on Ord Mantell. Can't imagine he'll be happy you lost them.
I'll work something out with Rogun, don't you worry.
We'll make a new deal.
Nobody "works things out" with Rogun the Butcher. I suggest you enjoy what's left of your life.
I'll make sure Rogun hears who really fouled things up for him.
He'll know the truth.
I'm sure you'll have lots to say while Rogun tortures you to death.
He'll be even less happy after I fry him.
Rogun doesn't scare me.
You honestly think you can kill someone like Rogun the Butcher? Where do you get these delusions?
Are you done posturing, Skavak? The captain and I have cargo to deliver.
Don't even think about cutting me out of this deal, Risha!
"Finders keepers." Isn't that what you always say? Not my fault the captain here beat you to the big prize.
Sweetheart, you two just made the biggest mistake of your lives.
Thought that blowhard would never switch off. So, we were discussing how I can make you fabulously wealthy.
The items here are pieces to a key--a key that unlocks the lost treasure of a very rich dead man named Nok Drayen.
Who's Nok Drayen?
Never heard of him.
Please tell me you're joking. The man was a criminal legend.
Rich, huh?
Just wait. It gets better.
Digging through old tombs isn't my line of work.
I don't know about this.
What? Afraid to get your hands dirty? It's a great way to get rich, trust me.
Nok Drayen was the greatest gangster who ever lived. He personally wiped out the Rath Cartel and the Vandelhelm Combine during the Syndicate Wars.
When he died ten years ago, Nok had more wealth than some Outer Rim worlds. Even the Hutts were jealous.
Nok sounds like my kind of guy.
I wish I'd met him.
He was ruthless, bloodthirsty and vindictive. The only criminals who didn't fear him were the dead ones.
What happened to Nok's fortune after he died?
Where did all that wealth go?
Now we're getting to the interesting part.
Is there a point to this?
Unlike Skavak, I don't just talk to hear myself. These details are important.
Nok hid his fortune right before he died. For ten years, treasure hunters across the galaxy have searched for it in vain--until now.
You see, I've finally figured out how to get the lost riches of Nok Drayen.
You're my new best friend, Risha.
Welcome to my ship.
That's sweet, but let's try to keep this professional for now.
But you can't do it alone.
Working with a professional would be refreshing.
Tell me how.
I know better than to just give up my secrets, Captain.
Whoever gets Nok's riches will become an underworld legend. Skavak had his chance and blew it. Now it's your turn.
Help me deliver these things in your cargo hold, and Nok Drayen's wealth will be all yours.
Let's make one thing clear. I only work for one person: me.
I'm not looking for a boss.
That's fine, but if you want to be rich, you'll let me work for you.
What are you getting out of this?
All mine?
I'm after something personal. The money doesn't mean anything to me, Captain.
What's to stop me from shoving you out the air lock?
You're very trusting.
The captain's just kidding. We don't do that kind of thing. Right?
Without me, these items are junk taking up valuable cargo space.
I'm the only one who can help you trade these items to get Nok Drayen's treasure, but I won't tell you everything up front.
To get the riches, you trust me the same way I trust you: one step at a time. Deal?
You had me at "riches."
Of course.
Then let's hit the hyperlanes.
We'll see if this treasure hunt of yours is worth it.
For now.
Once you get a taste of this job, I think you'll be hooked.
You'd better not betray me.
If anyone's taking a risk here, it's me. I'm trusting you to not stab me in the back, Captain.
We have deals set up on Taris and Nar Shaddaa. I'll make all the arrangements and introductions for you on both planets.
Until then, I'll be in my bunk. That caged beast there isn't much good for conversation, so come visit if you feel like chatting.
Strap yourself in. I'm hauling jets out of here.
Prepare for takeoff.
Music to my ears.
I'm sure you have some good stories about Skavak.
I'll do that.
Enough to make you glad you never dated him.
I'll be around for anything you need, sweetheart. Anything.
[Flirt] You won't be lonely.
That's a comfort.
I'm in this for the money, not friendship.
Won't need to.
Right. You're hard as duracrete, and I won't forget it.
Looking forward to working with you, Captain.
